column5: Cheesewhiz makes a pretty tasty grilled cheese sandwich as well, although i prefer a good cheddar. Add bacon and a poached egg and it be a heck of a breaky sandwich
Light coffee while I read the epapers. At work yogurt with cut up fruit, different every day. Snack on fruit all day long. Occationally on the weekend toast and eggs.

Weekdays is usually PC Ancient Grains cereal or peanut butter (crunchy) on multi grain toast. If I'm camping, there will be two sunny side eggs, runny with bacon (chewy)  or sausage. Tea or pressed or perk coffee with Baileys.  Like others, green tea but rotate it out with Chinese black tea or Jasmine tea.  Chad, try Yama Moto Yama green tea (sencha or genmai-cha), very nice.

Funny you say that, my wife's favorite green tea is genmaicha. Apparently the rice in the tea was originally used as a filler in times of austerity or when green tea was in short supply.   We eat a lot of that PC AG bread as well. A squirrels favorite.
Tim Horton's Everything bagel, double toasted with Herb and Garlic Cream Cheese, add Bacon too.  Try it.  The Bacon was a recent addition that is a hit!  RJ
Hope it's better than my Yamamoto Senko Tea!
Ha! A bass' favorite drink

Don't know how anyone can eat that other garbage.  I make a little of my own real maple syrup, but I actually prefer the cheap no-name brand stuff, even Aunt Jemima doesn't cut it, that's just me though  I also prefer cheap beer (no Moosehead or Sleemans etc), homemade wine  to LCBO stuff, cheap rye not Crown Royal,  I don't know if my cheapness has influenced my perception, or I'm just a red neck

During the week some kind of toasted bagel / toast / English muffin with peanut butter.  Weekends its easy over eggs, and I have become one of the hot sauce bunch...... a really good one, although not very hot, is the Chipotle Tabasco.  A really nice smokey flavour.  For added protein I like peameal bacon or a thin cut med. steak (don't like blood on the eggs!!!).  Burt
Nothing better than morning walleye... except maybe morning speckled trout

The regular is always coffee, in a dirty mug.  In season, it is bacon and tomato sandwiches. In winter  we have bacon with eggs or cheese for our sandwich.  Me and puppy dog also have our weekly fish brekkie.
Coffee and low fat sugar free yogurt.   So boring, but trying to drop a few.  I think my favorite is to hit a breakfast buffet.   Nothing like infinite bacon.
At most an English muffin and a glass of OJ... Beer is for Sunday mornings...

I always have a bowl of cereal with milk and a cut up banana.  Don't usually eat it until I get to work so I take it in a tupperware container with a jar of milk and the banana then make it at my desk.  And a Coke Zero of course or a decaf coffee if the guys at work go pick up coffee.  Now when I'm on Vaca, I love two eggs, sunny side up, hash browns made with real potatoes and fried in butter with spices, bacon (peameal or regular) and toast.
Does anyone ever do crepes? Once in awhile the kids make me cook spices crepes with cinnamon and blueberry, then we add butter and blueberrt jam, roll it up and sprinkle with icing sugar
Takes from 8am to 12 though to make enough haha
Crepes are great! Just spread some strawberry jam on them and roll em up, not many better breakfasts out there I can think of.
Now your talking MB haha Now I'm also looking forward to tomorrow morning
I have never eaten a crepe...

For me there's no such thing as breakfast, lunch or dinner.   If I'm hungry I eat !! Usually when I wake up I eat whatever was left over from the previous night. My favourite wake up meal is day old steak with an icy cold Dr. Pepper.
English muffin or crumpets. Apple,strawberries, raspberries or whatever is best fruit in season. Fresh ground Starbucks french roast coffee. This stuff is always here.
I have never eaten a crepe... you must not live close enough to quebec
Love cheese whiz on just about everything...never had it with my poached eggs/toast but I will try it tomorrow.
cornflakes and whiskey
And cheese whiz.
I have never eaten a crepe... Make it yourself, just make pancake batter and spread a very thin layer over your whole pan.
Bacon. Lots of bacon.
Well Lew two thumbs up for the cheese whiz on the toast with the poached eggs...it was great.
Well Lew two thumbs up for the cheese whiz on the toast with the poached eggs...it was great.  Good to hear you liked it as it's been a favorite of mine for a loooong time.
Breakfast..... droooooool!!!   I'll eat just about anything... but the whole big breakfast is hard to beat.
Liver, bacon and onions for me and the pooch this morning. Yummy!!!!
I made some Highbush Cranberry jam and put it on toast, a tasty accomplishment

Ok, a bit of a silly topic, but I LOVE me a good breakfast and I'm just curious what other peoples habits are. Also I typically eat my morning food ASAP, like minutes after I wake up. Can't imaging waiting unitl lunch like some people do!!  #1 morning food - Three sunny side up eggs with lots of pepper, three pieces of toast the last one with PB and jam,  #2 three egg omlett cooked in olive oil, no bread, tons of veggies and spices and seeds like turmeric, pepper, chia seeds, hemp seeds, sesame. This is my healthy Brek.  #3 if I'm short on time, some goofy kids cereal mixed with another cereal with actual substance like Oatmeal Crunch.   Morning Drink: Green Tea! I use the loose leaf stuff from David's Tea and it just so damn good compared to the sticks/dead leaf green tea from the bags.
Normally toast & cereal but this morning I'm having one of my favorites which is poached eggs on toast with cheese whiz on the toast before the egg.  Don't cringe until you try it
Cheeze Whiz?? Actually that doesn't sounds too bad! haha. My wife uses a spread out avocado as butter sometimes
Two eggs with hot sauce (Thanks Mike for this addiction!) and a coffee.
Coffee is it for me.  Have not 'eaten' breakfast for many years now.

For breakfast I normally have  Bowl of cereal + milk (sometimes I'll have oatmeal instead), 2 eggs (either boiled or scrambled), An avocado or a banana (sometimes a bit of watermelon during the summer), and a mug of green tea
Two eggs with hot sauce (Thanks Mike for this addiction!) and a coffee.  Keep that wader belt loose to avoid inflating

A coffee gets chugged immediately upon waking up.  But I have to wait at least an hour before I eat something.   By that time I'm at work, so it's usually just a cereal bar and a rice crispy square, or a muffin.  On the weekends, I love pancakes with local maple syrup. I stock up each spring at the Elmvale maple syrup festival.  The odd time I'll go all out.  Eggs, bacon, toast, pancakes, hash browns and fruit...  But that's usually only the day after a big party, in attempt to get the hung over people out of my house!
My favourite is fried smelts, and a poached egg on smoked salmon and an english muffin, with a glass of fresh orange juice. Usually it's just cereal LOL

I like a variety of breakfasts.  1. French toast with cinnamon and maple syrup 2. Two fried eggs with 2 sausages roasted potatoes and toast 3.  Home made Waffles with cinnamon and maple syrup 4. Poached eggs on toast with bacon 5. Toasted western sandwich 6. Scrambled eggs with hash browns , sausages and toast 7. Fruit breakfast, bananas, apples and grapes. Add any seasonal fruit also  Those are my regulars. Always a coffee when I wake up(can't find the planet without it) and one more with breakfast. Fruit breakfast is a must at least once a week. I always eat a good breakfast and then have a light lunch(usually fruit).  Muddler
just out of curiosity, when you guys have something with "maple syrup" do you guys use the good stuff or the disgusting fake stuff?
Coffee

If im working, i will eat something heavier with a good bit of carbs like a bagel and a bowl of oatmeal to keep my appetite up all day, but if im fishing i will keep things light until dinner time rolls around, fruit and maybe a can of tuna will keep me going all day.
steel cut oatmeal for me.  Have to watch my cholesterol.      Cut out coffee also.    Life is almost not worth living.   Nick
Only the real stuff for this guy!!  I used to eat the Walmart stuff, but now I support the local sugar bushes.

Denver sandwiches on rye with hot sauce, or eggs sunnyside up with hotsauce and seasoned hashbrowns or two common go to's. less often is two filleted of walleye, multigrain toast and eggs WITH HOT SAUCE. Actially i really do use hot sauce with almost everything lol
Only the real stuff for this guy!!  I used to eat the Walmart stuff, but now I support the local sugar bushes. Don't know how anyone can eat that other garbage.
Mine is boring---cereal and an orange, then tea soon as I get up. Eggs and/or yogurt and/or banana later.  That Aunt J's corn syrup, or any other corn syrup, is close to being toxic. Read up on it.

just out of curiosity, when you guys have something with "maple syrup" do you guys use the good stuff or the disgusting fake stuff? Relatives have a maple bush and make the real stuff every spring. The real stuff for me. Never tried anything else.  Muddler
Never tried anything else.  Don't.

Fresh Perch fried and 4 fried eggs,green tomato chow, toast and jam. OH ya, a few cups of coffee. Some days, good thick slice Bacon and fired Eggs, real home fries with onion and mushrooms,  bread fried in bacon fat. Breakfast like that you don't have to come off the lake till dark, no lunch or supper, just a few beers before bed time. Some days when I feel health conscious, Red River cereal or Oatmeal Porridge with brown sugar. Put like some mention just a coffee on the run and make it happen, get the boat on the truck and lets "GO"   , lots of time to eat latter, times-a-wastin, fishis to be caught And make sure the boat tank is full, dark is a long time off. If you only want to do half days,   stay on shore  .

Most days I have eggs scrambled with or without ham/bacon or just a few strips of bacon and a piece of cheese. The most important part of my breakfast is one that is never missed even on vacation. A large, properly brewed cup of espressowy goodness!!!

Always a 16 ounce cup of coffee after I feed the cats and then let the dog out to do her business...  This morning got away on me somehow so "brunch" was a couple of two egg western g'weeches (sort of) made with some chopped up leftover cottage roll, red pepper,minced dry onion and some seasoned salt on white toast...  I could have used some chopped up Leadbetters corn-meal bacon but I'm saving that for a corn-meal bacon on a bun for a lunch...  Most mornings it is coffee, cereal with sliced banana or blueberries, toast and jam...

My wife always gets on my case because it's generally the same thing every morning. Meds, Decaf, two slice of somekind of grain bread with peanut butter and fruit spread. Might stray from that if we are away at a cottage or camping.
After a great day on the water it looks like ill be having my walleye and eggs breakky tomorrow
